text:
RT @FaceTheNation Florida Sens. @marcorubio and @SenRickScott introduced a resolution to commemorate this day to honor the victims and survivors of the Parkland shooting.

“It offers the Senate's heartfelt condolences and deepest sympathies to the families, loved ones, and friends of the victims.” http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1096121870708105216/pu/img/0zE4VBZz_qmK8h3F.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1096121870708105216/pu/vid/320x180/MOUDJoYRAJI1UZGT.mp4?tag=6

I, too, want stronger border security, including a wall in some areas. But how we do things matters. Over 1,000 pages dropped in the middle of the night and extraconstitutional executive actions are wrong, no matter which party does them.

RT @akarl_smith .@AOC responding to criticism that by Amazon pulling out of HQ2 in Queens, 25,000 jobs were lost: "We were subsidizing those jobs." 

Says if state/city was willing to "give away $3 billion for this deal," investments can be made in hiring teachers and fixing the subway.

This week, we were proud to join @ChangeTheRef, @ManuelOliver00, Parkland students and many families. To them -- and families across the country -- we say: we will not rest until we #EndGunViolence! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzYNfCdXgAEPTLV.jpg

#OTD 149 years ago, Seraph Young became the first woman to vote in the United States—just two days after the Utah Territory passed its suffrage laws. 25 Utah women voted that day, nearly four decades before passage of the 19th Amendment. #utpol http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzY5NseXcAA8bT0.jpg

RT @PPact Everyone deserves to lead a life that is healthy and free from violence. 

Why gun violence prevention is a public health issue → https://www.plannedparenthoodaction.org/blog/the-gun-violence-epidemic-is-getting-worse-and-we-need-to-talk-about-it #EndGunViolence http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzYPwyoW0AAq5Ro.jpg

RT @RepTedDeutch Standing today and always with the community of Parkland and the families of the victims of the MSD shooting as we honor their lives one year after their tragic deaths. 

#NeverForget http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/DzXiaHFW0AASpxA.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DzXiaHFW0AASpxA.mp4

If you paid the $119 annual fee to become an Amazon Prime member, you paid more to Amazon than it paid in taxes. 

Our job: Repeal all of the Trump tax breaks for the top 1% and large corporations and demand that they pay their fair share in taxes. https://twitter.com/fortunemagazine/status/1096148361940471811 QT @FortuneMagazine Amazon will pay $0 in federal income taxes on $11.2 billion in profit. https://trib.al/QLZqWWz
Make El Chapo pay... https://action.tedcruz.org/el-chapo

Let’s go:

‘We’re starting a 15-city tour + a 50-State campaign, starting in early primary states, to build political and public support for a Green New Deal.’ - @sunrisemvmt

#ThisIsWhatDemocracyLooksLike ⬇️ https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1096016958099808256 QT @nowthisnews ‘The #GreenNewDeal is not just another climate policy … it is a call to redefine politics and establish a new social contract for America.’ — @JusticeDems, @sunrisemvmt, and @AOC are calling on politicians to make a choice: Fossil fuel money or a livable future http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1095790772014669824/img/cjkuWFkn6-Hq0GoJ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1095790772014669824/vid/320x320/bS-x8u4S5gPdQLYo.mp4?tag=9
The Congress will defend our constitutional authorities.

Declaring a national emergency would be a lawless act, a gross abuse of the power of the presidency and a desperate attempt to distract from the fact that @realDonaldTrump broke his core promise to have Mexico pay for his wall.

It’s outrageous that lynching still isn’t considered a federal crime. Congress tried and failed near 200 times between 1882 to 1986. About to ask the Senate to unanimously pass our anti-lynching bill. Let’s right this wrong.
Democrats are sending legislation to the President’s desk to #KeepGovernmentOpen. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1nAKEyyeNoaKL

There are about a zillion reasons why I love my sweetie Bruce, but I wanted to mention one: he’s always been my biggest supporter. Happy Valentine’s Day, Sweetie. I’m very lucky to have you by my side for all of life’s big adventures. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZ50P4WoAA2sVF.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZ50rQXQAA--hA.jpg
I’m glad to hear that @DenverTeachers can go back to work with fair wages. When we fight, we win. https://www.denverpost.com/2019/02/14/denver-teachers-strike-agreement-reached/

I will not support using devastated communities in #Florida as pawns for some future legislative deal. 

Read my statement on the 2019 Omnibus Spending bill --> https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=Press-Releases&id=DF492447-444A-4F9E-B7AC-F26870C9CE08 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZiXpBXcAEaOoh.png
There is not a "national emergency" with regard to the southern border. What President Trump is doing is unlawful and must be opposed vigorously in the courts and legislatively.

I'll reserve judgment on any potential executive action by the President until I'm able to fully evaluate it, but as I’ve said, I don't believe declaring a national emergency is the right approach. I'd also expect the President to stay within statutory and constitutional limits.

My mother was born on February 14, and she loved her special connection to Valentine’s Day. Here’s how I remember her every year. https://medium.com/@teamwarren/my-valentines-day-tradition-3f062d5c6a55?source=friends_link&sk=fa1f337723e65e60bf5a2c68e9d47ec1

ICYMI on @FoxNews with @ShannonBream: I filed the EL CHAPO Act, which says all money criminally forfeited from 'El Chapo' and from any other drug lord shall be used for border security and to build the wall.  #ELCHAPOAct #SecureTheBorder http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1096083758174875648/img/_KVsdarW0U9Ws64y.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1096083758174875648/vid/320x180/EjlTBqyW3AiPhFiH.mp4?tag=9

Lynching is still not a federally designated hate crime. It's time to change that. Today @SenKamalaHarris and I again got unanimous consent to pass our Justice for Victims of Lynching Act in the Senate.

Now let's pass this bill in the House and get it signed into law! http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1096092659964436481/pu/img/E2BA41DeJ6SmktF1.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1096092659964436481/pu/vid/320x320/njC-R-WlsBCgnCWh.mp4?tag=6

I don’t want to outlaw stock buybacks.

But they shouldn’t receive beneficial tax treatment. They should be treated just like dividends.

What we should give beneficial treatment to is productive investment by making full expensing permanent. 

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-14/yell-all-you-want-about-stock-buybacks-they-re-not-slowing-down

I am confident William Barr understands the unique challenges our country faces today and the important role the Department of Justice plays in confronting those challenges. 

My statement --> https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=Press-Releases&id=6D3AB26A-E3D4-4E54-A0B2-58AB33D8E9E4 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzY5CJzWoAkaOeI.jpg

The Senate just unanimously passed our bill to make lynching a federal crime. This bill acknowledges the wrongs in our history and honors the memories of those brutally killed. Making this law is the right thing to do—I hope the House will move quickly to pass.

Mexico wouldn't pay for @realDonaldTrump's wall. Congress wouldn't fully fund it. So now he's throwing a temper tantrum and declaring a "national emergency." My new bill would stop him from using disaster recovery funds for his pet project. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/14/us/politics/trump-national-emergency-border.html
I’m disappointed with both the massive, bloated, secretive bill that just passed and with the president’s intention to declare an emergency to build a wall.

While today's funding bill is far from perfect, it includes critical funding for border security and immigration enforcement, and prevents another harmful government shutdown. I am glad the Senate was able to conclude this unfinished business from last year.

A year ago today, someone intent on doing harm was able to murder 17 students and teachers in Parkland because they had a military-grade gun. 

We grieve with victims’ families. And we fight alongside the Parkland students to fix our laws. #ParklandStrong
RT @nytopinion From the Editorial Board: The real national emergency is President Trump's disregard for the Constitution https://trib.al/7yekxHT
In advance of Presidents' Day, test your Presidential trivia knowledge with our brand new quiz 👉 https://m.me/tedcruzpage?ref=w4803431 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzYFJq0X0AAtAft.jpg

It is only right that El Chapo's ill-gotten gains go to fixing the problem and securing the border.

Pass the #ELCHAPOAct: https://action.tedcruz.org/el-chapo/

Decorated gymnast @Simone_Biles was six years old when she was introduced to gymnastics and insisted her parents enroll her at the gym. Years later, that same persistence would lead her to become the first woman gymnast to win three consecutive World All-Around titles. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/DzZ5wMwX0AA6xFO.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DzZ5wMwX0AA6xFO.mp4

I’m inspired by the young people who are leading the way, including the brave students from Parkland. If the grown-ups won’t act, they will. https://twitter.com/cameron_kasky/status/1096061554544517126 QT @cameron_kasky Our community could have cowered in fear and thrown itself a pity party, but instead, Parkland told the world that we aren’t going to take this anymore. Not this time. Not again. We refused to give up. That’s why when you hear “Parkland,” you think about strength, not weakness.
I will wait to see what specific course of action the president pursues and what legal authorities are cited as a basis for it.

NOW: I am speaking on the Senate floor to honor the 17 lives we lost one year ago today. Our nation was forever changed by the tragic events that unfolded in #Parkland, #Florida, & I remain committed to ensuring it will never happen again.

Watch: https://www.senate.gov/floor/

No child should be denied a loving home because the family that wishes to adopt them is LGBTQ or a religious minority. The Trump Admin must deny states’ unconstitutional waiver requests & make sure child welfare stays at the heart of our state child welfare systems.

Oakland’s restorative justice program, one of the primary alternatives to traditional school discipline, is in jeopardy. These programs are critical and we should be supporting more programs like these. 
https://edsource.org/2019/acclaimed-restorative-justice-program-on-the-chopping-block-in-oakland-unified/608473
It is yet another demonstration of @realDonaldTrump’s naked contempt for the rule of law. This is not an emergency, and the President’s fearmongering doesn’t make it one.
@TweetBenMax I think so. Grassroots community members led + organized the whole effort. Wouldn’t have happened if they weren’t there.

RT @TPPF .@robhenneke was on @FoxFriendsFirst this morning to discuss the #ELCHAPOAct. We need more common sense proposals (like this) coming out of Washington. @SenTedCruz 

Great job, Rob! 👏 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzXb-YLV4AA3NKd.jpg

RT @RepLanceGooden I've signed on as a co-sponsor to this legislation. The Mexican cartels have caused irreparable harm to our nation - let's use these seized funds and make them pay for the wall.

https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/429666-ted-cruz-wants-to-make-el-chapo-pay-for-border-trumps-border-wall

I will be holding my weekly press conference today at 3:30 pm ET. Tune in here: https://www.facebook.com/NancyPelosi/videos/1775548082549345/?__xts__%5B0%5D=68.ARDoaj82bCbSnFx-6O3-pleL-PfGsGZA84SKkJwNIWViR2mYF4kmJGRA_F9a2bGInuHTPwJWDetv7Ynd3benahjtkxGAX8FuKAal5p79kKT378iLu7hvMqPJMGOLIby77pQh93Bv-EUY9LURry7MlRzdoskervM6JpTLQVpEqDimCh3GYqY3YXLc_jyLiMeb6Dqao-L3g3w1kamU6a4vy9q2jNE2hI1p9eSb3PLUyLM98Sy9-k5tIaIYfZpbHEEdNRnEhJVQhow0j-4BUgV7uf5G75AJ-bGom0wjgW_AIye-3xcet1S-CyZidqpCLi4s8xMYBzMKH63lAYbzcC_sbpAPN0ntuM00UA&__tn__=-R http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzY-jPnW0AE64E4.jpg

I will continue fighting to secure our southern border.
 
Democrats’ intransigence has left the president with no other choice but to take executive action. I’m a constitutionalist & have long advocated that every president be bound by the Constitution and federal laws.

RT @JimmyVanBramer Defeating an anti-union corporation that mistreats workers and assists ICE in terrorizing immigrant communities is a victory. Defeating an unprecedented act of corporate welfare is a triumph that should change the way we do economic development deals in our city & state forever.

Lynching is a murder. It’s torture. But after a century of trying, it’s still not a federal crime. It’s time to fix that - that's why this morning @SenBooker and I are going to ask our Senate colleagues to unanimously approve my anti-lynching bill.

The American people gave Congress a clear mandate: #SecureTheBorder & build the wall. These are critical priorities – for Texas and the country.  
 
Unfortunately, this spending bill is a bad deal, and fails to reflect these priorities by not sufficiently securing the border.

I applaud @RepSeanMaloney, @RepAngieCraig & @RepKatieHill for leading the charge against the blatantly unconstitutional attempt to allow the GOP’s anti-LGBTQ, anti-Semitic & anti-Muslim bigotry to take root in our foster & adoption systems. https://seanmaloney.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/lgbtq-parents-in-congress-maloney-and-craig-and-hill-lead-letter-to-hhs

.@realDonaldTrump couldn’t convince Mexico, the American people or their elected representatives to pay for his ineffective and expensive wall, so now he’s trying an end-run around Congress in a desperate attempt to put taxpayers on the hook for it.

Looking forward to giving this morning's keynote address at the 2019 SLS-ORION-EGS Suppliers Conference. Tune in to my Facebook page at ~8:30am CT to watch my remarks live! --> http://www.facebook.com/SenatorTedCruz

Our kids are America’s future. I told the crowd in Iowa City: I’m fighting for a government in Washington that will invest in our children and our grandchildren. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZoWk-XcAIRkfC.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZoX_mX0AAfyk_.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZocsMWwAQdc-o.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZoeJsXQAEZ4kt.jpg

The great economic crisis we face is the grotesque level of income and wealth inequality. When so few have so much, and so many have so little, a handful of billionaires end up controlling our economic and political life. That has got to change. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/06/opinion/abolish-billionaires-tax.html?action=click&module=Associated&pgtype=Article&region=Footer&contentCollection=Farhad%20Manjoo

BREAKING: Our anti-lynching bill, which would make lynching a federal crime, just unanimously passed the Senate. Lynching is a dark, despicable part of our nation's history and I'm hopeful this measure will swiftly pass the House.
RT @Astro_Clay Senator @TedCruz has an idea on how to fund President @realDonaldTrump's proposed border wall... Make El Chapo pay for it! Join the fight --> http://action.tedcruz.org/el-chapo/

RT @chriskrokshow A lot of people have been saying we should use El Chapo's seized assets to fund construction of the border wall. Ted Cruz has introduced a bill that would make that possible... 
http://www.wbap.com/?p=1263996

Today marks one year since the horrific shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, yet Congress has failed to act on any meaningful legislation to prevent another mass shooting. This isn’t a question of left or right, it’s about protecting our children from gun violence. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/DzYnf0nW0AAoK7h.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DzYnf0nW0AAoK7h.mp4

RT @nkolakowski The HQ2 "search" was always a thinly disguised attempt to extract maximum tax concessions for opening a satellite office. If you want proof of that: Amazon isn't re-opening the HQ2 search, and it's still hiring in NYC.

In the richest nation in the history of the world, it's a moral and political failing that nearly 30 million Americans don’t have health insurance. We must go forward to finally guarantee health care for all as a right through a Medicare for All, single-payer program.
Thankful to have the support of my friend and progressive leader, @BLeeForCongress. http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/DzZgx3WX0AA_QnV.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DzZgx3WX0AA_QnV.mp4

I’m headed to the Senate floor right now to request my colleagues unanimously pass my anti-lynching bill. It’s absurd that Congress has tried and failed to do this dozens of times for the better part of a century. Let’s get it done. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1096082729261768704/pu/img/A4Xm65R884JvrGwC.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1096082729261768704/pu/vid/320x568/KeKmd2k9T_I23U1f.mp4?tag=6

A year after America’s heart was broken by the horrific act of brutality & violence in Parkland that stole 17 precious lives, we continue to be inspired by the persistence & courage of the survivors and families who have turned their pain into action. #MSDStrong http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1096174422476636160/img/OXiDi9bhjMYJ3wB7.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1096174422476636160/vid/320x180/o2l1oJNnYDLdEBzd.mp4?tag=9

Our resolution also recognizes the strength & resilience of the Parkland community. 2/2

My colleagues & I have introduced two bills to prohibit the president from diverting military construction and disaster relief funds to his vanity project of a border wall. It's clear now that he is willing to go around Congress to do this. We must pass these bills immediately.
I’m speaking with reporters live from the Capitol ahead of the House’s vote on the deal to #KeepGovernmentOpen. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1YqJDyyANmoxV

Anything is possible: today was the day a group of dedicated, everyday New Yorkers & their neighbors defeated Amazon’s corporate greed, its worker exploitation, and the power of the richest man in the world. https://twitter.com/jdavidgoodman/status/1096087641953632258 QT @jdavidgoodman AMAZON CANCELS PLAN TO COME TO NEW YORK

"After much thought and deliberation, we’ve decided not to move forward with our plans to build a headquarters for Amazon in Long Island City, Queens" - Amazon spokeswoman Jodi Seth

RT @BarackObama In the year since their friends were killed, the students of Parkland refused to settle for the way things are and marched, organized, and pushed for the way things should be - helping pass meaningful new gun violence laws in states across the country. I'm proud of all of them.

Productive meeting with my friend the President of #Colombia @IvanDuque and members of his cabinet. 

The United States remains committed to our strong alliance, supporting democracy in the region and countering narcoterrorists. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZklxkWwAgEG1Y.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZklxnX4AAnNgd.jpg

I’m tired of hearing that we can’t afford things that address deep problems in our country. It’s just not true. We are the wealthiest nation in the history of the world – of course we can afford to invest in making sure every American has health care. https://twitter.com/DafnaLinzer/status/1094621109759238150 QT @DafnaLinzer This stark photo taken this week in Knoxville tells a very different story about the economy http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzDgGJhXQAAR9I-.jpg

One year ago today our country was forever changed by the tragic events that unfolded in #Parkland, #Florida. Over the past year, we have worked to fix the specific flaws in the system that led to this tragedy.  Today, I reaffirm that commitment.

I’m deeply disappointed that the Senate confirmed William Barr as US Attorney General. I’ll keep fighting to protect the Affordable Care Act and Roe v. Wade – and I’ll do everything I can to ensure that Special Counsel Mueller can do his job without interference. https://twitter.com/BostonGlobe/status/1096118122598359046 QT @BostonGlobe The Senate has confirmed William Barr as attorney general, placing the veteran government official and lawyer atop the Justice Department as special counsel Robert Mueller investigates Russian interference in the 2016 election. http://w.bos.gl/W2vx6Do http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzYxn4VWwAMotot.png

Millions of Americans are already living paycheck to paycheck. We shouldn’t punish people who went to school to further their education. That’s not right. 
https://www.cnbc.com/amp/2019/02/13/a-gop-proposal-would-snatch-your-student-loan-payment-right-from-your-paycheck.html

We have a crisis at our southern border, but no crisis justifies violating the Constitution. 

My statement on the potential national emergency declaration --> https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=Press-Releases&id=DF492447-444A-4F9E-B7AC-F26870C9CE08 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzZjHYNXcAojk_v.png
The Walton family makes more money in one minute than Walmart workers do in an entire year. This is what we mean when we talk about a rigged economy.

Sound points. But I don’t want to ban buybacks. If firms don’t have investments worth making,they can still return cash to shareholders. But why give buybacks a tax preference? Lets tax them  same as dividends & give preference to productive investments. https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-02-14/rubio-s-stock-buyback-plan-is-probably-sound

While I have concerns about this bill, I supported it because I can’t turn my back on the 2 million federal employees and private contractors who would be forced again to work without pay. I am also concerned about the millions who would be denied access to government services. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1096159466523971584 QT @politico Breaking: The Senate passed a bipartisan spending measure to avert another government shutdown on an 83-16 vote https://www.politico.com/story/2019/02/14/spending-bill-vote-government-shutdown-1170006

Today marks 1 year since the devastating Parkland mass shooting. From the brave defiance of its student survivors, we now have a GVP House Majority that will pass universal background checks.​ #NeverForget http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DzYJifNW0AE7eG_.jpg

Amazon is paying $0 in taxes on $11+ billion in profit.

$0 for schools.
$0 for firefighters.
$0 for infrastructure.
$0 for research and healthcare.

President Barack Obama declared a national emergency in 2009 during the swine flu outbreak. President George W. Bush declared a national emergency the day after the 9/11 attacks.

Those were national emergencies.

RT @RepAdamSchiff Trump is declaring a national emergency to bypass Congress, to build a wall we don’t need, to address a crisis that doesn’t exist, by claiming an authority he doesn’t have.
 
If that sounds like nonsense, it’s because it is. It’s also plainly unconstitutional.

One year ago, the #Parkland community lost 17 lives in a heinous act of gun violence. #SinceParkland 1,200 kids in America have been killed by guns. It’s long past time we unite in common purpose and pass common sense gun safety legislation to prevent more tragedy.

Happy Valentine's Day! Today I decided to release a special Valentine themed waste report about $1,200,000 used to study online dating.
